alert.note: Alert for Eastern King William; Eastern King and Queen; Western King William (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 7:39AM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central King and Queen, central New Kent and southeastern King William Counties through 815 AM EDT... At 738 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over King William, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, frequent lightning and possible small hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... New Kent, King William, West Point, Talleysville, King And Queen Court House, Tunstall, Little Plymouth, Eltham, Cohoke, Westwood, Lanexa, Rose Garden, Colonial Downs, Lanesville, Palls, Cooke, Romancoke, Slaterville and Plum Point. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Eastern King William; Eastern King and Queen; Western King William
